H0.text: Ideal conditions allow populations to grow exponentially.

H1.text: Pleasant conditions are those under which populations can grow exponentially.

H2.text: Useful conditions are those under which populations can grow exponentially.

H3.text: Lush conditions are those under which populations can grow exponentially.

A4.text: Most populations do not grow exponentially, rather they follow a logistic model.

A5.text: Once the population has reached its carrying capacity, it will stabilize and the exponential curve will level off towards the carrying capacity.

A6.text: Exponential growth cannot continue indefinitely, however, because the medium is soon depleted of nutrients and enriched with wastes.

A7.text: The slope of this line is the specific growth rate of the organism, which is a measure of the number of divisions per cell per unit time.

A8.text: When the population size is small, the population increases exponentially.
